items.headline: ‘Our HOA fees are too high’: Do my husband and I sell our $700K condo and rent by the beach?
items.summary_en: “My husband, 71, and I, 66, are retired, with total combined assets of $1.5 million.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: Professional and wealthy investors still plan to boost crypto holdings even after sharp slide
items.summary_en: The recent drop in crypto prices isn’t denting enthusiasm from wealthy and professional investors to boost allocations.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: My brother is the trustee of our parents’ $10 million estate. He’s threatened to bleed the estate dry. What now?
items.summary_en: “He is paying himself $40 per hour or $1,600 per week to manage the estate.”

items.headline: McDonald’s and other companies are calling out the impact of SNAP delays on consumers
items.summary_en: One analyst says payment delays across states are likely, even after the government’s reopening.

items.headline: I’m 83 and will have $500K if I sell my house. My estranged wife wants me to join her in Colombia. Do I go?
items.summary_en: “I can just barely handle my expenses with a mortgage payment of $984 and an income of $3,800.”

items.headline: Yes, stock investors, there is a Santa Claus rally. No, it isn’t coming early.
items.summary_en: Wall Street wants you to believe that a year-end stock-market rally starts now.

items.headline: Why Target’s price cuts on thousands of items are more than just a sales gimmick
items.summary_en: Coupled with the company’s recent layoff announcement, the price cuts reflect a decisive move by the incoming CEO to change the status quo.

items.headline: My husband, 73, is giving me a life estate in his home, yet leaving his son a $200K Porsche. Is this cause for divorce?
items.summary_en: “I am not listed on his bank accounts.”

items.headline: ‘I’m in a financial mess’: My income was cut in half. Do I sell my $600K home and kiss my 2.9% mortgage rate goodbye?
items.summary_en: “We can move 10 miles south, where property is much cheaper.”

items.headline: ‘He lives paycheck to paycheck’: My husband pays his bills late and sits at home playing on his computer. How do I fix it?
items.summary_en: “He seems to think ‘bill due’ dates are a suggestion. He has literally no savings.”
